definition: to ascend/to rise to the rank of/to promote/to hoist/liter/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth dou 斗[dou3]

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: Lift up the car , remove wheels .
sentences.chinese: 首先升起汽車，卸下輪榖。

sentences.english: They raised the pirate flag, with its picture of a skull and crossed bones.
sentences.chinese: 他們升起海盜旗，上面畫着骷髏頭和交叉的兩把刀。

sentences.english: The damp rising from the ground caused the walls to stain badly.
sentences.chinese: 地面上升起的潮氣使牆壁的顏色變得很難看。

sentences.english: The Sun Also Rises is a love story.
sentences.chinese: 太陽照樣升起》是一部愛情小說。

sentences.english: Smoke curls slowly from the chimney.
The company said that is not white smoke rising from the unit fuel storage pool.
sentences.chinese: 該公司說，白煙並非從機組燃料儲存池中升起。

sentences.english: Then have the alarm set about 30 minutes after the suns fully up.
sentences.chinese: 然後，將鬧鐘定到太陽完全升起後約30分鐘的時刻。

sentences.english: While Jove 's planet rises yonder, silent over Africa.
sentences.chinese: 當朱匹特的行星高高升起，默默凝照着非洲的大地。

sentences.english: They stood on the top of the mountain, watching the sun rising in the east.
sentences.chinese: 他們站在山頂上，看着太陽正從東方升起。

sentences.english: It was the gloomy star of the police which was rising in the sewer.
sentences.chinese: 這是保安警察的陰暗的星光在陰渠中升起了。

sentences.english: The third time we met, we were strolling along the beach in the moonlight.
sentences.chinese: 第三次在月亮升起時，他約我去海邊散步。

sentences.english: Hang all your leafy banners out!
sentences.chinese: 升起你全部木葉如同旌旗招展。

sentences.english: The waist buttocks use the flexible connection, in raises in the process the patient not easy to glide down.
sentences.chinese: 腰臀部採用軟連接，在升起的過程中病人不易下滑。

sentences.english: Swirls of smoke rose through the trees.
sentences.chinese: 樹林中升起盤旋的青煙。

sentences.english: Seeing the rise of the bright sun on the horizon, I know that a new day has begun.
sentences.chinese: 看到天邊曈曈紅日的升起，我知道新的一天又開始了。

sentences.english: We saw his star as it rose, and we have come to worship him.
sentences.chinese: 我們看見屬於他的那顆星升起了，我們來朝覲。

definition: to well up/to boil out/to bubble forth/to spurt
to ignite/to light/fig. to spark off (hopes, controversy, flames of revolution)
to float up/to rise to the surface/fig. to rise in the world
arising involuntarily (idiom); spontaneous/to spring up unbidden (of emotion)
to flit across/to sweep past/to glance (strike at an angle)
to gush/to gush out/to pour out
variant of 彌漫|弥漫[mi2 man4]
